Pre-Game Insights: France is hoping to recover in front of their native supporters after losing to Spain in the Euro 2024 semi-finals.
Italy is keen to bounce back from a dismal Euro 2024 performance where they were eliminated by Switzerland in the Round of 16.
Sandro Scharer from Switzerland will be the referee for the match.
The Parc des Princes in Paris has a capacity of 48,229 and is expected to be packed with fervent supporters.
Didier Deschamps will need to address inconsistencies in France’s recent form to ensure a positive start in the UEFA Nations League.
Luciano Spalletti is expected to adopt a more dynamic and flexible formation for Italy.
Italy will be missing key players like Gianluca Scamacca and Nicolo Barella due to injuries.
France’s squad is still considered stronger despite missing Wesley Fofana and Ferland Mendy.
France has a slight edge in recent head-to-head encounters, having won three of the last five matches.
The home advantage and support from the Parc des Princes could give France a psychological edge.
Both teams are under pressure to perform after disappointing campaigns in recent tournaments.
